group_1.textLeft: Sorry for callin' ya out here so early@in the morning.

group_1.textRight: Apparently, from what Yuta told me,@you guys had a rough time last night...?

group_1.textLeft: Well, in truth...
We were out at sea last night,@investigating the village legend.

group_1.textRight: What...? In the middle of night?!

group_1.textLeft: It was a real challenge, but we learned@something about that legend.
Turns out the ship that the Diviner and@the sailor were on really did sink...
...but they both actually survived.
They never got to see each other again,@even though they were so close...
It was just as Yuta theorized.
We found the sailor's trade ship on@the ocean floor.

group_1.textRight: Still, that alone doesn't indicate that@the Diviner survived...

group_1.textLeft: We know she did because...@I saw her memories.
That Diviner and I have a lot in common.
So when I saw her memories, I knew...
...that the Diviner from the legend@survived the shipwreck,
and waited in vain for the sailor@to return to her...

group_1.textRight: I thought it was a sad story from how@the legend was told...
But knowing she waited for someone@who never came...makes it even sadder...

group_1.textLeft: Yeah...
That's why I asked Shizuka and her friends...
...to go talk to the elder about changing@the village's custom.
If we can convince him, you'll be free.
No one will punish you for falling in love@with Yuta,
or for having feelings for him.
I wanted you to be the one I told@this story to first, Miyo.
If I hadn't met you back then and@asked you what was up...
...I wouldn't have been able to look@into the village legend,
let alone help it reconsider its tradition.

group_1.textRight: But...why were you so driven to help me?
You're a complete outsider, after all.
You could've just said no. It's none of@your business, after all...

group_1.textLeft: Well, that's...
